My friend and I had the bacon cheddar, the regular, the mushroom, and the  buffalo. All were tasty, and the sauerkraut, slaw, asparagus salad, and pickled cabbage that came with it really complemented them nicely. I'd definitely go back!
author: Janet Z.

description:
My brother used to feast on frozen pierogis, with dollops and dollops of sour cream, so my preconceived notion of pierogis was negative. But I forced a couple friends to go, because it's important to have an open mind

Stuffed changed everything. I had a Bacon/Cheddar and an Avocado/Spicy sausage. Phe-NOM-menal. I also had a bite of the buffalo one, which was pretty good too. 

Two should fill you up just fine. If you're still hungry, you can go get a taco across the street or something.
author: Joe H.

description: Oh. So. Delicious. Happy Belly. Multiple Stuffing combinations and all of them yummy. They have a house wine (actually from the family vineyard) which is really cool and decent beer. I love this whole in the wall for a good hearty meal when I'm hungry.
author: Zara S.

description: The food was different. It was my 1st time here and I liked the hospitality of the people that work there. I just didn't know if I should have went here if I wanted real authentic polish food.
author: Giselle J.

description:
If you want authentic pierogis with a modern twist, this is the place to go!!! This place has that  traditional polish taste to it yet it's cool and hip enough to blend with the mission crowd. 
Every time I'm in the neighborhood, I always try to stop by here. It's amazing how the whole place is managed by this nice guy who happens to be the owner as well. He makes everything from scratch and always welcomes you with a smile.
author: Afarin S.

description: Pierogi was soggy and broke apart. Pierogis are supposed to be smaller and firmer. I don't understand what was wrong with a classic potato and cheese pierogi with a little horseradish sour cream.
author: Jason G.

description:
We went here and I guess it was kind of early for them... they seem to do more business later in the evening. The owners are very friendly and welcoming. You can choose to sit at the counter, which is kind of set up like a bar, and there are also tables and a booth, even outdoors in front of the restaurant. The pierogis are tasty, but they could have been heated up a little more. Also, I feel the sauerkraut was not so great. I'm thinking it's not homemade? 

I am definitely coming back, though, because I think this restaurant will improve.
author: Janette R.

description: Hip hole in the wall joint. Little effort in terms of comfort and amenities. But food makes up for it. Super great option for late nite eats!
author: Tina L.

description: Their pierogi's were alright (kind of sloppy and ripped up from being reheated on a pan and the golombki were also ok. Definitely not traditional polish food but not the worst either. Their borscht was missing some dill but overall was delicious and my favorite dish at this place.
author: Kob A.

description: Super cute New spot right next to the 24th street Bart! They serve beer and wine that the owner makes himself. Menu has awesome stuff like bacon cheddar pierogis and jalapeno potato pierogis. I wish I left room for a blueberry pierogi for dessert, but alas, I am stuffed!
author: Stacey T.

description: My fiancée and I ordered the buffalo,  mushroom, and jalapeño.  All were very good but our favorite was buffalo.  The sauerkraut,slaw and asparagus salad were heavenly!  I'm a big guy with a heafty appetite and left stuffed.  Dana (owner) was an absolute sweetie and very attentive.  I definitely recommend Stuffed!
author: Carlton C.

description: Unpretentious place with yummy food. I enjoyed the spicy avocado pierogi and the side sausage even more, washed down with a crisp (no pun intended) Crispin. Not a place for ambiance, but a chill place to grab some food and hang out.
author: Melinda C.

description: This place was great! And it's fairly new to the neighborhood. Came here with my boyfriend for a bite before the gym. My favorite was the Traditional. Can't beat good ol' potatoes and cheeeeese for me! His favorite was the Spicy Avocado Sausage. I already see this place being one of our usuals. Oh, and the owner and staff were really friendly. Big plus!
author: Lea S.

description:
Mission is a street in SF that runs the gamut of the city, in length, aspiration and culture.

This restaurant is in the more Hispanic part of SF with all it's shops and authentic eateries. You're more likely to run into Pablo here than Posey.

This restaurant has set itself up in the middle of a smallish setup, similar in dimension to many of the taquerias around here. 

It has a pleasant patio area outside, with tables. Inside there is a long counter stretching the length of the restaurant where you can chill and chat to the owner and other pierogi lovers. 

There's only a single table inside at the back which can seat a family comfortably. 

Couple of TV's playing whatever and Indy background music. Sets of handmade dominos litter the counter. Nearly beat my missus for the first time. Lost by 2 points.

The booze menu is limited and cheap. Got myself a $2 miller, I think it was, but could've splurged on a PBT ( in honor of their Midwestern roots). Which brings us to the food..

They wanted to try something which they hadn't seen in SF, which they found in pierogi. While in Poland you can't go a mile without running into a pierogerria, this is the only one I've seen here.

And they're not bad. The flavors run an epic gamut from more traditional ones like potato cheese ones to weird ones like salmon. They sell them in plates of 2 or 3 including a salad

They are larger than I've seen in Poland but they were tasty. Some were a little thicker than others, which comes with hand making.

Where this place is truly outstanding is in the salads. The plates come with a choice of salads and from the coleslaw to the sauerkraut, these are truly great. So much so we bought some to take home.

Worth a visit in your gastronomic hunts.
author: Pantera W.

description: Stuffed: a satisfying hole-in-the-wall serving up unique versions of their take on the classic Polish pierogi. While traditional fillings include cheese, bacon, and mushrooms (yum!), venture out and try the more exotic flavors such as jalapeno or salmon. Perhaps just as good as the pierogi are the side salads that accompany each order; cabbage never tasted so good! When you go, be patient, don't expect fast service, but trust that your belly will be content. Smacznego!
author: Paul J.

description: Amazing pierogi place. I had a Ukrainian roommate in college who used to make these and I haven't had them since I left philly. Stuffed was amazing and brought back memories of the lovely stuffed boiled dumplings with perfectly cooked salmon potatoes and mushrooms. Super affordable - I usually get the 5 piece plate for 2 people and it's usually too much unless we are really hungry.
author: Pranav K.

description: I love this place, the food is really good and the staff is cool.  I've been there twice now and both experiences have been very satisfying.  The food is hearty but light, and tastes very fresh, with good portions.  My favorite side is the borscht soup and favorite pierogie is the avocado and spicy sausage.  It's also very convenient being right next to BART for picking up.
author: Keith R.

description: None too fancy or trendy digs, but just blow your mind pierogi greatness! I can't wait to go back to try more of their many varieties. I grew up on this food as it was prepared from scratch using passed down recipes from the old country but Stuffed succeeded to take it to another level for me.
author: Bill B.

description: So delicious. Randomly came upon this place after outsidelands! Very helpful waiters and awesome atmosphere. Really worth trying out especially if you've never had perogis.
author: David K.

description: I live in Fresno Ca and I drive to Bay Area JUST to eat delicious food made fresh at stuffed!!   Love the atmosphere and the staff!!!
author: Ric C.

description:
Great food, great people. 
The pierogi is not to be underestimated. 
The mushroom pierogi in particular, was one of the most savory vegitarian dishes. I will definitely recommend it
author: Youyu T.

description:
We came in no one in line decided to sit at the long counter.  The server helped two people who were came in after we sat but looked over and said she would be with us in a moment.  A line formed, and after she took the orders of the next six people while ignoring us we got up and left.

Horrible service!!  If you require people to order before sitting at the counter, tell them instead of ignoring them.
author: Larry H.

description: Came here one day and got some pierogis. There were very good, and big! My favorites were the blue cheese with buffalo and the chicken and feta were my favorites. The others were also good, though. If you come here with two or four people, you can get 2 of the 2 pierogis for the same price as 5 pierogis. That's what we did and it was enough food.
author: E G.

description:
Friendly staff, great interior design that is welcoming and comfortable. 
Food is AMAZING. I don't think I've been able to pick a favorite one yet.
author: Towanda S.

description: Pierogies, pierogies and pierogies!!! Spicy ones at that too. And if you want to really heat things up, try the chilly!
author: Aravindh P.

description: WOW! is this SUPER YUMMY!!!  The food is wonderful and the customer service is just as terrific!  I ordered a variety so we could try them all....Bacon & Cheddar, Mushroom, Chicken, Traditional, Spicy Avocado & Buffalo.  They are all super good.  Note when they say spicy they mean it!  We also had Borscht and sausages - all of it was so good I need to go back and get more!  Parking is not great there, but you can order on line and pick up which was very easy.  This is truly a must frequent!!!!
author: Bailey K.

description: Great, friendly service..and FANTASTIC food! My favorite pierogi was the bacon cheddar..and smoked salmon (hard to pick one). The slaw and apple sauerkraut were the best I've had of slaws and Sauerkrauts so far. Ambiance is clean-divey, but with clean bathrooms. Overall great experience and I'd come back again!
author: Liz L.

description:
I can't find a bad thing to say about this place. It has the makings to be a great place to hangout. Great food, great beer on tap, friendly and attentive proprietor. We had 5 different kinds of pierogis-traditional, buffalo, mushroom, spinach and the dessert. Each one of them was more delicious than the previous one we tasted. Sauerkraut was quite unique with apples and an asparagus salad. Also the Borscht! Oh the Borscht!  
I can't wait to go back there! 
Cheers!
author: Raj C.

description: Love this place. So warm and comforting, and such a great meal for the price. Authentic atmosphere, good beer, good wifi.... I don't want Stuffed to ever leave.
author: Rick S.

description: This was an amazing spot that I highly recommend to any perioge lover! Great selection, I would eat the 3 dinner plate again with avocado, mushroom, and goat cheese perioges all over again tomorrow. Great people, with Cleveland pride. I'll be back!
author: Allison A.

description: Yummmmmmmmm!!! Meant to go get Mexican food and saw this while waiting in line. Best choice of my life to deviate from my date's plans and come here instead without him. Amazing pierogee and sides. Kept it simple with the traditional potato and cheese. Delicious. When I come back to SF this is on my list of musts to come back to. Polish food done right! I felt like I was back in Pennsylvania eating at a church pierogee sale! A must stop!!
author: Amy S.

description:
Ordered:
Traditional potato and cheese
Spicy avocado sausage
Mushroom/spinach pierogi
Split pea soup

I have absolutely no experience with pierogis, so my opinion is probably as worthless as someone who thinks orange chicken is the paragon of Chinese cuisine.  

Anyway, this was just really, really solid comfort food.  I'm not sure the flavors were as savory as I had hoped, but the 3 pierogi meal would pretty much be the perfect hangover cure.  Would definitely come back here!
author: Norman S.

description: We stumbled onto this place by accident and it was the best afternoon we have ever spent! I am polish/australian and the food was amazing and very polish. Its a lovely casual place for cheap beers delicious food and some fun games. I would definitely come back for all of it. Even just as a cool hang out bar, this place has personality and heart. But seriously the food is amazing. My favourite is the blue cheese perogis and you must have the blue berry perogis for dessert are a must. This place is seriously awesome.
author: Jay C.

description: Made from scratch including the fixings!  You will not be disappointed with any pierogi.  There's a passion that goes into making them that brings alive the authentic,  unforgettable taste.  Apple sauerkraut made with apples and cooked with agave plus a purple cabbage salad with it.  Even if you're not  from the Great Lakes region this is a 'must' taste.
author: James D.

description: It's something different in the Mission!  The pasta-like perogies are fun to mix and match, and won't break the bank.  We got there early and staked out a table out front.  Inside has counter seating.  Our party of 4 felt like being social, so we took our spot on the little patio out front.  We met the cook and the owner, and I gotta say that made the night really fun for us.  I give this place 5 stars because it's so dang unique, a gem of a place in the "casual dining" arena, the owners were over the top nice, the patio was comfortable, and we stayed for 3 hours without even knowing where the time went.  The food was good -- I really liked it -- but the evening was something I'll never forget.
author: Jenny F.

description:
Just went to this place for a friend's birthday this past weekend (1/31/15), so we ordered several types of pierogi, the cheddar bacon and the buffalo pierogis being my favorites.  The borscht was good too.

What was really lacking was the quality of service.  They were understaffed.  We had one guy come take our drink orders, then another person came later to make recommendations, then the guy came back with some drinks, only to find that he forgot one drink order.  Then the other person came back with the missing beer, then the other guy came with another beer that the other person already covered.  They didn't communicate with each other because it seems there were only two folks doing the order and servicing.  The food took awhile to get doled out...we ordered at least 6 plates of different pierogis...which was fine because it gave everyone in the party to mingle and chit chat.  But with dishes all coming out at different times, is was hard for folks to wait for the particular pierogis they really wanted.  There was no thought about presentation, and it thinking back, it was like going to a cafeteria.

So ultimately, if you're looking for quality food, and it's just you or a small party, and go here knowing that service will be spotty (the servers were always polite and accommodating...they just need more of them), then I think you'll enjoy the experience.  However, if you're looking for a full service, decent food presentation and you're in a larger group, I'd pass.  It's good, but the whole experience was ok.  The place is setup like a big "greasy spoon" sorta diner, with seats at the counter and tables only outside.  This is more divey than a quality sit-down/full service sorta place...very casual attire.  I would give TWO stars, but staff was pleasant, so they get THREE starts from me.
author: Kona L.

description: I'm so in LOVE with Stuffed. I've never eaten so many Brussels sprouts!!! Finding any reason to go on Mission street. I think I might just need to travel to Walgreen's!!! Hmmmm
author: Aisha H.

description:
i love perogies!!!

i was so excited to try this perogie place. i went to grad school in the midwest and that was the first time i tried them. after moving back to the west coast i've never seen them again and missed them so much. i was so happy to find this place! they also serve great lakes brewery beers which is only found in the midwest. it was like going back to college.

this place is expensive for what you get. i feel for the price you pay you're not really getting a lot. you only get 3 perogies. i was still starving after eating my meal and there isn't much to order other than perogies wine and beer to choose from. i would love it if they expanded their menu a little bit more to have some appetizers or something.


the wine is homemade? the first wine i tired was so sour and awful i swear it was bad. i'm not really a wine expert or anything so i forced myself to drink it. i got to the point where it was just TOO SOUR it must have been BAD WINE. i had to tell the bartender to return it.

not a lot of seating but there is some outside seating that has barriers for privacy. i love this because i can bring my dog! and she can sit outside and enjoy the meal with us without too many distractions since there were barriers. 

don't get me wrong the perogies were amazing. AMAZING! and i'd love to go back for more and some great lake brews
author: Amanda K.

description: Everything we had was delicious!! I want to go back and try every kind of pierogi. I'm so happy that this place exists. The only reason why I didn't give it five stars is because they didn't have beer on tap.
author: Kerri B.

description: As a Polish guy from Chicago, you can imagine my excitement when I found stuffed. All of the pierogis were good, but the desert pierogi is the one that I now dream about.
author: Robert S.

description: Grew up with Polish food and this is as good as it gets. The variety is truly fantastic: buffalo with blue cheese and the mushroom were my favorites. Good variety of beers for all tastes.  Your tummy will say "thank you!" when you're done. Pass this place on to your friends and family.
author: Mike K.

description: Stuffed is excellent! I had the bacon cheddar, salmon, and blue cheese Pierogi, and they were all amazing. Dana, owner/manager is super cool and friendly. Cheers!
author: Michael S.

description: Great pierogis, I was confused why no one was in there on a Saturday night. I was on a food tour of the Mission and we stopped here, so glad we did!
author: Carina H.

description: This is my favorite spot for Eastern European comfort food. Delicious, fresh pierogies made in-house. I brought my Polish mother here and she is now obsessed with Stuffed. Everyone I've brought here has raved about their pierogies and beer selection. Not to mention it's not expensive. If you're down for Eastern Euro food, definitely check this spot out.
author: Kristen D.

description: 45 minutes for our order (4 perogi and one salad) that came out wrong, with a dog running in and out of the kitchen area and filthy tables... Probably won't be back.  Also, the lack of an updates menu with items that weren't available was really frustrating.  Good luck Stuffed, you're gonna need it.
author: Kate E.

description: Nice addition to the city. I'm pretty certain this is the ONLY pierogi spot in town. Located right near 24th BART. Great spot to jump into and get a couple perogis and a beer while waiting for BART. Owner is cool and loves to talk. I think he like sold his house in Wisconsin to start this place so go in and support a small business! If we lose this place your pierogi will need to be cured with a crappy frozen one from Safeway.
author: H K.

description:
I had a super good experience here due to the very nice people running the place and the tasty pierogi.  The pierogi are like homemade, for better and for worse -- a bit inconsistent, like they're still working out the kinks, but basically very tasty and at a fair price for the neighborhood.  I really like that they come with sour cream and sauerkraut or slaw and only wish they had an apple sauce option/side as well (I'd even pay a little extra for a side of apple sauce!).  The traditional ones were really good.  I also tried mushroom, salmon, and bacon/cheese, all of which were fine, and I admire them for trying new things, although I probably liked the traditional ones best.  I will definitely be back and look forward to trying new flavors as they are introduced! 

I really liked the unpretentious, casual atmosphere and friendly people.  

Oh hey.  One other thing.  Not enough places have hooks under the counter for hanging a bag.  This place does.  Kudos!  That put me in a good mood from the beginning.
author: Rachel J.

description:
I was out with a friend looking for a place to eat in the Mission when we read the establishment name, Stuffed. We instantly thought of something like Thanksgiving dinner. Stuffed is a word that equates to feeling like we just had the most epic meal of our lives and not only are we now so slated that we can't move, but also, that the journey there was totally worth it. Let me tell you, our expectations were not let down.

I know what you're thinking: What the hell is a PIEROGI? I thought the same thing when I decided to try this random food I've never heard of. The menu seems a little intimidating  when you first walk in because you don't quite know what you're ordering. But...salmon, mushrooms, bacon, and cheese. You can't go wrong with any of those. We asked Andy, the manager, for a recommendation and he said, without hesitation: "mushroom pierogi and salmon pierogi." But then Dana, the owner, chimed in with, "Don't forget the bacon and cheddar pierogi!" 
So we ordered two of each. They arrived in front of us in under ten minutes with a side of hummus and sour cream for each basket. As we took our first daring bite of the salmon pierogi, it was something we can only compare to a giant ravioli?... Actually, it's utterly incomparable to other foods. It was a flavor blast that instantly put a smile on our face. We thought for sure that the salmon pierogi had to be the best one. And then we tried the mushroom pierogi. And then we tried the bacon cheddar pierogi. Even now, we can't tell you which is our favorite. We were dumbfounded that something we had never even heard of could be so good. It's like never hearing of pizza and trying it for the first time. 

The atmosphere in this bar-styled restaurant was so easy going and chill that it was easy to try something new while enjoying an Anchor Steam / Blue Moon, while casually trying things off the menu. 

Highly recommend this restaurant. By the end, we were most certainly STUFFED. We'll be back tomorrow for more, because there is still more PIEROGIES to try. 

Those who dare...benefit greatly!
author: Jason N.

description:
Good to have a new restaurant that isn't a taqueria in the Mission--1 star for that.
It's also heartening to see new businesses on Mission st as well, though when sitting outside you might feel the need to guard your belongings!

The pierogis were good, but they were quite small for the price. We tried the traditional, bacon, salmon and mushroom (bacon was the best). Nearly $30 for lunch for 2, and we were still hungry afterwards.

Make the pierogis bigger if you're going to charge $4-5+/per pierogi (they come in orders of 2-3 with a tiny side of slaw or kraut). They should be the size of a generous empanada for the money.

In the meantime, I suppose I will stick to $8 burritos where I can have lunch and leftovers for another meal!
author: J L.

description: I could not even try their food. I and my friend showed up today during their business hours and... the place was closed! What a bummer. We drove all the way to the city, found parking, walked up to the place and this! Very disappointing.
author: Sergei G.

description: I had the mushroom and the jalapeño pierogi's and the cucumber salad, and the sauerkraut was good too.
author: Meredith G.

description: I'm Polish, and have had ample opportunity to eat "authentic" pierogi all my life. Still, Stuffed provided me with the most delicious traditional and blueberry pierogi I've ever had.
author: N I.

description: Representing for my hometown Cleveland with delicious perogies and Great Lakes brews. Thank you!
author: Ali R.

description: Good food reasonable prices. I tried the salmon mushrooms and dessert option three items all tasty fresh made good ingredients
author: Jingo Django J.

description: Tasty, quick, friendly, cheap, filling. What's not to like? Borscht is really quite good. Favorite is the salmon and the spicy avocado.
author: Faceless E.

description: Cane here last night after bar hopping in the mission. Fun and casual spot for delicious eats. My boo and I shared three perogies: mushroom, bacon, and spinach & goat cheese. Perogies are essentially like large polish potstickers. The cook pan fried the perogies and the kitchen is completely open so you see all the action before your very eyes. My favorite was the spinach & goat cheese. I felt like the mushroom one was a little soggy due to the mushrooms releasing liquid while it cooked. The perogies also come with some relish sides and onions which are a nice complement. The cook/waiter took a few dollars off because they ran out of some sides. I thought that was really nice of him.
author: Grace Y.

description: Nice space, great pierogis! Sides ( sauerkraut and cabbage slaw) are awesome too! Will be coming back :)
author: Errol O.

description: I've been waiting for *years* to find a good pierogi place in San Francisco, and was not let down by Stuffed. They could have kept it at just traditional and I would have been happy! That said, I'm glad I also tried: bacon and cheddar, salmon, and mushroom. Super friendly staff, I hope this place is around for a long time!
author: Adam D.

description: Gluten free fillings were tasty. Especially the spinach and goat cheese. But I can't recommend the bacon and cheese. Too salty. May need the wrapper...
author: David B.

description: My grandmother was this little Ukrainian woman from Poland so my youth was overflowing with Pierogi. They were a constant staple in our house and I haven't had anything close to the fresh ones she made since she passed away. I tried Stuffed for the first time tonight and was completely blown away! The pierogi were splendid and for a brief moment I was transported back in time. Will definitely become a regular place for me.
author: Alex H.

description: Aaaaaah-mazing. Tried the mushroom with spinach shell. Mmmmm Mmmm good.
author: Alan M.

description: Great! My family and I love this place. The food is great. My kids love going for Pierogis. Warm and friendly staff. What's next? Wiener Schnitzel? Keep up the good work.
author: mark f.

description: Pretty good food, pierogi nearly as the authentic ones. Not sure why they are served with sour cream, I assume that's American thing. Only the traditional stuffing is the real kne, the other ones are made up, however overall idea is there. Will definetely come back!
author: Emilia O.

description: Holy yum!  Stopped in for lunch last week.  I ordered 3 vegetarian ones and the fiance enjoyed the meat selections.  Mushroom one was my fave!  Great little place, friendly service, nice and quiet little front patio which is surprising considering bits ON mission.  I liked that we could be "outside enjoying the people watching without drunks tripping over us.   The food was excellent and we will be back for more!
author: Nicole W.

description: I liked the mushroom pierogi (nice touch with the hummus), and the beer is cheap (for the Mission). Would love to see some taps in the future. Will come back for some long-missed Yuengling when they have it.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Tasty food and good service. They didn't seem to be doing much business when I was in on a Friday night so I hope they last.
author: Patrick S.

description:
This place is awesome! This restaurant is the passion project of the husband/wife duo that owns it. Service was friendly and quick.

My dinner group got a mix of different pierogi. I didn't think that I would like the salmon pierogi, but it actually ended up being my favorite! The salmon is not overwhelming with a fishy flavor, and the dough is delicious and warm. A close 2nd favorite was the goat cheese and spinach one. 

I definitely felt satisfied after two pierogi, but it was so good that I went ahead and ate the third one.
author: Ellie M.

description:
The other reviews are right, you can't really go wrong with any of their choices.  The owner is super friendly and personable.

I can't think of a single other place in the city to get Polish food, this guy has cornered the market.  Hit them up!
author: John B.

description:
Let me just say, I've been stoked about them opening for a while. The Pierogi was good and the beer was just as good. Reminded me of being back in some humble joint in Chicago. No pretentious SF attitudes here, just good food and beer. 

I can also say that I was so stoked, I bought everyone in the bar a beer... twice. It's not really that big of a deal considering beer is midwest cheap. A tall boy (24) of Pabst is only $4. I can't think of any place that's cheaper than this. 

Service was fantastic and there were friendly faces all around. It's nice to be in a place that's down to earth, friendly and homey. This is the place your drunk Polish grandpa would go to hang out with his friends after work had it existed years ago, but hey you can still bring your drunk Polish grandpa here! It's not too late to bond over a beer and talk of old country.
author: Andrew L.

description: I've never really had pierogi before but I've found out they are awesome!  Doughy, bacony goodness.  I especially like the spicy jalapeño ones.  Also, the beer selection is vast.  Eclectic but cheap and good.  A great find in the neighborhood.
author: Bumpus H.

description: Bacon cheddar all day!!! So good! The owner is really sweet. I think she is born in raised in San Francisco but bringing us her family secrets! Lucky us. If you are near 24th and mission you have to step in and try Stuffed!
author: Brittny R.

description: bacon cheddar and buffalo are the favorites so far, cheap brews, cool almost 50s atmosphere but without the cheesy vinyl chrome look, super friendly staff! I'll be back!
author: Drew V.

description: Everything is great about this place: awesome pierogi , beer & the staff is very friendly. Highly recommended for a quick casual lunch or dinner.
author: Marc P.

description: This place is great for $10 you get 2 pierogis. I think this place could kill it if they expanded the menu and made the pierogis the " we kick ass at" item and offer other items and weather the storm until you guys kill it. The owner has a good heart I hope you guys make it. The food is like what your friends mom would cook that you would want to come over for dinner when you were a kid....
author: Christian A.

description: This place was pierogi heaven!  I LOVED it.  Can't wait to go back and try their other pierogi concoctions (had the mushroom, bacon/cheddar, and goat cheese/spinach). Delicious!  The side salads were divine, too. Go eat there NOW!
author: Universal Citizen S.

description: My boyfriend drove us all the way to San Francisco from the East Bay just to try this place.  Oh man we were not disappointed, in fact I think we are obsessed!  We had a long talk with the owners who are wonderful and down to earth and the pierogi are just delicious!  I just love that the flavors are creative and interesting, especially the buffalo (OMG I'm still dreaming about it).  I can totally see them expanding and trying new things!  We will DEFINITELY be back and soon!
author: Nicole G.

description: I came here for lunch today, craving some savory and tasty food, and was positively delighted with my meal, and pleased to have found a new lunch or dinner destination. I got 2 pierogies (mushroom, and traditional), which came with a cucumber salad, sauerkraut and a beet salad. Every bite I took of this scrumptious meal brought me a new level of happiness. I couldn't even tell you what my husband was saying to me during the meal, as I just thought about all the delicious flavors and textures of the food. So good, so good. I will be back next weekend, most definitely. And to put this in perspective, I rarely find myself so pleased with food that I'm willing to take time to give a restaurant a review. So, yeah - that's how much I enjoyed my lunch today.
author: Heather C.

description: Great food, warm welcoming atmosphere, & AWESOME people. The Spinach & Mushroom pierogi, & the Bacon & Cheddar pierogi are my favorites!!!
author: Bradley H.

description: Comfort food and beer! A perfectly wide variety of pierogis, and the most appetizing presentation.  Felt as if I had stumbled upon an ancient hole-in-the-wall, but young owner Dana has only been panning these love bombs before your eyes less than two years--timeless.  Complete with a variety of matched sauces/condiments, was i-phone photo worthy.  Also had the wonderful borscht with a lovely oatmeal stout, part of a great meal deal.  Even received a generous/tall sample of Dana's dad's blue ribbon Oregon cab, Giants home game on the big screen, friendly local patrons..  In short, a new Stuffed apostle.
author: Peter Q.

description: Wonderful experience - both outdoor and bar seating. Excellent food and a rich diversity in terms of what you get with your plate, colors, flavors. Definitely will be going back and taking friends. A must try in the city!
author: Ali L.

description: Delicious pierogis... If you've never had one, this is a good place to start. If you have had them, this is a good spot to continue your love affair with them. Bacon/cheddar and jalapeño are my personal favorites.
author: Derric T.

description: I stopped by for a quick dinner.  The pierogies are great, the sides are tasty and healthy and $3.00 Mimosas!!!  Conveniently located across from the BART station.  What a find.
author: Donna M.

description: Beers from the Midwest you cant find anywhere in the bay area. Pirogi that are varied and lovingly and artistically  flavored. Heavy Metal Music soothing your soul in the background.  Owners that are taking your orders with a smile and total commitment to service. I cant wait to go back! If you like beer? Or Pirogi, or both! you will NOT be disappointing. I cant recommend enough. Go, and go now to make sure this place makes it. With what is happening in the Mission right now, the next storefront in that spot may be a starbucks...maybe that's what the 24 year old with Twitter stock options would prefer. Guess we'll see.
author: Ben B.

description: Hole in the wall serving a nice range of classic and new-fangled pierogis and beers, with good sides (slaw, sauerkraut, cuke salad), too. Dark, old school, diner counter vibe, all your favorite hard rock hits on the sound system - great lunch or late night place.
author: tw s.

description: I love me a well-crafted pierogi and Stuffed delivers! I highly recommend the bacon/cheddar pierogi or the salmon/cream cheese. The sauerkraut is an awesome side. They are a little on the small side though for the price - so be sure to order a few. Also earns major points for decently priced beer selection that includes Olympia!
author: Nathan H.

description: Finally open! The owners are nice and their pierogi are huge... I'll be going back.
author: Philip R.

description: Really good, fresh tasting polish foods and sides. Tried warm borscht for the very first time and this one was fantastic - and vegetarian. Also the fun factor - the persons behind the counter were welcoming and hospitable and the other customers were friendly. We ended up hanging with them until the place closed. Chri, Melinda and Ryan's comments help sum up our experience.
author: Don K.

description: I've been wanting to try this place for a while and am so freaking happy I did! First off, the chick behind the counter was awesome as was the dude. I got the mushroom, buffalo and bacon. All three were parties in my mouth along with the yummy sides and all for under $20! I'll be back!
author: Jihad L.

description: the staff was incredibly nice, and the pierogis ok. pierogis were big and completely overpriced ($5 pp - per piergoi???), but good. wait take that back, they put hummus with a pierogi. terrible idea. no way, that was really bad. wish them well but not sure how long they will be around.
author: Natalia W.

description: LOVE this place.  Great homemade non-greasy food and outdoor tables.  Dinner for $10.  Blueberry with homemade ricotta are a divine desert to finish off the meal.
author: Lori A.

description: The food is quite tasty and the service is fast, but the price to serving-size ratio leaves something to be desired. $10 for 3 pierogi that won't fill you up is no deal.
author: Alvin O.

description: Wow! Walked past this place on a visit to San Francisco, and we were so glad we decided to give it a try. It was a great experience all around. I thoroughly enjoyed each pierogi I tried- and I don't even normally like potatoes! The service was excellent and staff were very friendly. Highly recommended.
author: Hannah H.

description: This place is great, with a friendly staff and very reasonable prices! I love the mushroom piroshki!
author: Ned D.

description: This place is surprisingly delicious. It's a hidden gem in the neighborhood. The owners are really nice and service is fast. Overall I enjoyed their jalapeño pierogi and the borscht the most. Decent beer selection, nice service and great food. This has a become a hang out spot of mine.  Would recommend this place to anyone.
author: Liz P.

description: Love the Pierogi's. If 10 people walk in at once, it can slow down the service. Other than that, this is an awesome example of doing one thing really well. Love all the flavors, it just hits the spot. My hope is this place takes off and they can afford some back-up staff! That's all it needs to be a go-to spot in the mission. In the meantime, it's still my go-to.
author: Rebecca P.

description: Delicious pierogi in great varieties with nice sides. But had to dock a few stars for extreme disorganization and it took forever to actually get the food, drinks and everything else! They need to hire more help.
author: A D.

description: We have been to stuffed three times now since they opened and each time was great! The owners waited on us and were just completely friendly. The traditional flavor  pierogies are just like i grew up eating in Chicago. The sides they come with were delicious, i wanted even more! Then top it off with a beer for the feeling of being 'stuffed' indeed. My friends loved the pierogies with bacon and cheese and the buffalo sauce with bleu cheese was great too. The menu is super simple and to the point! Pierogies and beer! Enjoy!
author: Mae Y.

description: I came here for the perogies (sp?). It's so hard to find a place that makes these tasty treats. And it STILL is. Sadly, Stuffed is not all that great. It's not even that particularly good. We tried the mushroom one, which is beyond bland, and the bacon one. The bacon one was flavorful, only because bacon has such a strong flavor by itself, it's hard to miss. Not only were they bland, but the dough is kinda chewy and hard in some places. These bad boys are pricey too, 3 of them for $13! Ouch. And is you want the salmon one then it's 3 for $15.
author: Elysia D.

description: The owners, Dana and her partner, are the wait staff/cooks. They've put their heart and soul into this place, and it shows. She offered to refill our sides at no charge, no problem. Service is especially nice if you eat at the bar, a very "Cheers" feeling, with TV usually showing a sports game. Great selection of beer. Pierogis are comfort food -- my husband's favorite is Buffalo -- I loved the salmon, and it ties with the mushroom for my fave. The traditional is also great. O -- their cold asparagus side salad is a dream.
author: S R.

description: I loooove this place! I just moved here from TX and this is by far some of the best comfort food you can get! I haven't had a pierogi yet that I didn't like.The owners are very inviting and are super friendly. It's a good place to chill with friends or alone. This is my new cheers :)
author: Avinell R.

description: I had my first pierogi ever tonight and I have to say, I LIKED IT!  I had three to be exact. I chose the bacon potato cheddar ones.  Yum!  I'm a super picky eater and rarely try new things but I'm glad I went outside my comfort zone.  I'll be making more visits here for sure.
author: Mike A.

description: This place is awesome! It nails traditional polish Pierogi dishes for hardcore purists but it also has new unique takes on the pierogi idea: like avocado and salsa, salmon, jalapenio, mushroom. All Polish people living in the Bay Area should try pierogi at Stuffed. You won't be disappointed fellow Poles. The owners are super friendly and they like to share their story. Even though they are not Polish, they nailed the dumpling experience. On another note, the layout and decor leave space for improvement and the music selection could be better but, these are just minor details. Overall, delicious homemade, and hearty meal.
author: Monika B.
